result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A Pekala

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.

1:25 PM Defendant Daniel A Pekala in court.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts in court for Daniel A Pekala.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Watts stands mute to all counts.  Court enters NG pleas be entered and TSC to be set in about 60 days.  Bonds continued.
Return date on September 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 11:34 AM Defendant Daniel A Pekala in court. Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Saralinda Watts @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing  10/1/22

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on September 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel A Pekala appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Eklund. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/C.R.D.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
